alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 18 at 9:16PM AKDT until October 19 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Near the Taiya River. * WHEN...Until 600 AM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 915 PM AKDT, Satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate moderate to heavy rain across the warned area. Flooding is expected to begin Tuesday night, especially near the Taiya River. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.75 to 2.5 inches are possible. - Areas along low lying portions of the Chilkoot Trail and the Dyea Road are the most likely places to experience flooding. - For Taiya River near Skagway: At 8:00pm the stage was 15.64 feet. Flood Stage is 16.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 18.26 feet is expected around 4:00am Wednesday. Impacts: At 17.5 feet: The National Park Service may close the Chilkoot Trail due to flooding impacts associated with high water in the surrounding watershed.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
